intro: Heliophila oreophila, commonly known as the mountain heliophila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Heliophila oreophila is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
